q: "This has been the heart of the problem in Detroit," said Sergio Marchionne , who also heads up Fiat, the Italian auto company. Alan Mulally said Ford has learned that it has to deal with the current reality. You have to match production to real demand and accelerate development of new products that people will want to buy. For Ford that meant going with a plan for massive restructuring to a consortium of banks and borrowing$ 23.5 billion, he said. For GM and Chrysler it meant bankruptcy filings and huge bailouts

In the past two years, Soliman has stepped out of the shadows, and allowed himself to be photographed, and his meetings with foreign leaders reported. Many of our contacts believe that Soliman, because of his military background, would at least have to figure in any succession scenario. From 1993 until Saturday, Omar Suleiman was chief of Egypt"s Colin Powell Intelligence Service.
